<title level="1" right="Rules">[Invisible](/Rules.aspx?ID=2420)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 434 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
A creature with the [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=83) condition (by way of an [_invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1577) spell, for example) is automatically [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) to any creatures relying on sight as their only [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=2406). Precise senses other than sight ignore the invisible condition. You can [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) to attempt to figure out an invisible creature's location, making it only hidden from you. This lasts until the invisible creature successfully uses [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=2405) to become undetected again. If you're already [observing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=84) a creature when it becomes invisible, it starts out [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79), since you know where it was, though it can then Sneak to become undetected.

Other effects might partially foil invisibility. For instance, if you were tracking an invisible creature's footprints through the snow, the footprints would make it hidden. Throwing a [net](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2738) over an invisible creature would make it observed but [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) for as long as the net is on it.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
